verses.verse: I will love<WH7355> you<WH3068>, O Lord, my strength<WH2391>.

The Lord<WH3068> is my rock<WH5553>, and my fortress<WH4686>, and my deliverer<WH6403>; my God<WH410>, my strength<WH6697>, in whom I will trust<WH2620>; my shield<WH4043>, and the horn<WH7161> of my salvation<WH3468>, and my high tower<WH4869>.
I will call<WH7121> upon the Lord<WH3068>, who is worthy to be praised<WH1984>: so shall I be saved<WH3467> from my enemies<WH341>.
The sorrows<WH2256> of death<WH4194> surrounded<WH661> me<WH5158>, and the floods of ungodly men<WH1100> made me afraid<WH1204>.
The sorrows<WH2256> of hell<WH7585> surrounded me about<WH5437>: the snares<WH4170> of death<WH4194> prevented me<WH6923>.

In my distress<WH6862> I called<WH7121> upon the Lord<WH3068>, and cried<WH7768> unto my God<WH430>: he heard<WH8085> my voice<WH6963> out of his temple<WH1964>, and my cry<WH7775> came<WH935> before<WH6440> him<WH241>, even into his ears.
Then the earth<WH776> shook<WH1607> and trembled<WH7493>; the foundations<WH4146> also of the hills<WH2022> moved<WH7264> and were shaken<WH1607>, because he was angry<WH2734>.
There went up<WH5927> a smoke<WH6227> out of his nostrils<WH639>, and fire<WH784> out of his mouth<WH6310> devoured<WH398>: coals<WH1513> were kindled by it<WH1197>.
He bowed<WH5186> the heavens<WH8064> also<WH3381>, and came down: and darkness<WH6205> was under his feet<WH7272>.
And he rode<WH7392> upon a cherub<WH3742>, and did fly<WH5774>: Yes<WH1675>, he did fly upon the wings<WH3671> of the wind<WH7307>.
He made<WH7896> darkness<WH2822> his secret place<WH5643>; his pavilion<WH5521> round about<WH5439> him were dark<WH2824> waters<WH4325> and thick clouds<WH5645> of the skies<WH7834>.
At the brightness<WH5051> that was before him his thick clouds<WH5645> passed<WH5674>, hail<WH1259> stones and coals<WH1513> of fire<WH784>.
The Lord<WH3068> also thundered<WH7481> in the heavens<WH8064>, and the Highest<WH5945> gave<WH5414> his voice<WH6963>; hail<WH1259> stones and coals<WH1513> of fire<WH784>.
Yes<WH7971>, he sent out his arrows<WH2671>, and scattered<WH6327> them<WH7232>; and he shot out lightnings<WH1300>, and defeated them<WH2000>.

Then the channels<WH650> of waters<WH4325> were seen<WH7200>, and the foundations<WH4146> of the world<WH8398> were discovered<WH1540> at your rebuke<WH1606>, O Lord<WH3068>, at the blast<WH5397> of the breath<WH7307> of your nostrils<WH639>.
He sent<WH7971> from above<WH4791>, he took<WH3947> me<WH4871>, he drew me out of many<WH7227> waters<WH4325>.
He delivered<WH5337> me from my strong<WH5794> enemy<WH341>, and from them which hated<WH8130> me<WH553>: for they were too strong for me.
They prevented<WH6923> me in the day<WH3117> of my calamity<WH343>: but the Lord<WH3068> was my stay<WH4937>.
He brought me forth<WH3318> also into a large place<WH4800>; he delivered<WH2502> me<WH2654>, because he delighted in me.
The Lord<WH3068> rewarded<WH1580> me according to my righteousness<WH6664>; according to the cleanness<WH1252> of my hands<WH3027> has he recompensed me<WH7725>.
For I have kept<WH8104> the ways<WH1870> of the Lord<WH3068>, and have not wickedly departed<WH7561> from my God<WH430>.
For all his judgments<WH4941> were before me<WH5493>, and I did not put away his statutes from me<WH2708>.
I was also upright<WH8549> before him<WH8104>, and I kept myself from my iniquity<WH5771>.
Therefore has the Lord<WH3068> recompensed<WH7725> me according to my righteousness<WH6664>, according to the cleanness<WH1252> of my hands<WH3027> in his eyesight<WH5869>.
With the merciful<WH2623> you will show yourself merciful<WH2616>; with a upright<WH8549> man<WH1399> you will show yourself upright<WH8552>;
With the pure<WH1305> you will show yourself pure<WH1305>; and with the perverse<WH6141> you will show yourself perverse<WH6617>.
For you will save<WH3467> the afflicted<WH6041> people<WH5971>; but will bring down<WH8213> high<WH7311> looks<WH5869>.
For you will light<WH215> my candle<WH5216>: the Lord<WH3068> my God<WH430> will enlighten<WH5050> my darkness<WH2822>.
For by you I have run through<WH7323> a troop<WH1416>; and by my God<WH430> have I leaped over<WH1801> a wall<WH7791>.
As for God<WH410>, his way<WH1870> is perfect<WH8549>: the word<WH565> of the Lord<WH3068> is tried<WH6884>: he is a shield<WH4043> to all those that trust in him<WH2620>.
For who is God<WH433> save<WH1107> the Lord<WH3068>? or who is a rock<WH6697> save<WH2108> our God<WH430>?
It is God<WH410> that puts<WH247> me with strength<WH2428>, and makes<WH5414> my way<WH1870> perfect<WH8549>.
He makes<WH7737> my feet<WH7272> like hinds<WH355>' feet<WH5975>, and sets me upon my high places<WH1116>.
He teaches<WH3925> my hands<WH3027> to war<WH4421>, so that a bow<WH7198> of steel<WH5154> is broken<WH5181> by my arms<WH2220>.
You have also given<WH5414> me the shield<WH4043> of your salvation<WH3468>: and your right hand<WH3225> has held me up<WH5582>, and your gentleness<WH6037> has made me great<WH7235>.
You have enlarged<WH7337> my steps<WH6806> under me<WH7166>, that my feet did not slip<WH4571>.
I have pursued<WH7291> my enemies<WH341>, and overtaken<WH5381> them<WH7725>: neither did I turn again until they were consumed<WH3615>.
I have wounded<WH4272> them that they were not able<WH3201> to rise<WH6965>: they are fallen<WH5307> under my feet<WH7272>.
For you have girded<WH247> me with strength<WH2428> unto the battle<WH4421>: you have subdued<WH3766> under me those that rose up against me<WH6965>.
You have also given<WH5414> me the necks<WH6203> of my enemies<WH341>; that I might destroy<WH6789> them that hate me<WH8130>.
They cried<WH7768>, but there was none to save<WH3467> them<WH3068>: even unto the Lord, but he answered them not<WH6030>.
Then did I beat<WH7833> them small as the dust<WH6083> before<WH6440> the wind<WH7307>: I did cast them out<WH7324> as the dirt<WH2916> in the streets<WH2351>.

You have delivered<WH6403> me from the strivings<WH7379> of the people<WH5971>; and you have made<WH7760> me the head<WH7218> of the heathen<WH1471>: a people<WH5971> whom I have not known<WH3045> shall serve me<WH5647>.
As soon as they hear<WH8088> of me<WH8085>, they shall obey me<WH1121>: the strangers shall submit themselves unto me<WH3584>.
The strangers<WH1121> shall fade away<WH5034>, and be afraid<WH2727> out of their close places<WH4526>.
The Lord<WH3068> lives<WH2416>; and blessed<WH1288> be my rock<WH6697>; and let the God<WH430> of my salvation<WH3468> be exalted<WH7311>.
It is God<WH410> that avenges<WH5414> me<WH1696>, and subdues the people under me<WH5971>.
He delivers<WH6403> me from my enemies<WH341>: Yes<WH7311>, you lift me up above those that rise up<WH6965> against me<WH5337>: you have delivered me from the violent<WH2555> man<WH376>.
Therefore will I give thanks<WH3034> unto you<WH3068>, O Lord, among the heathen<WH1471>, and sing praises<WH2167> unto your name<WH8034>.
Great<WH1431> deliverance<WH3444> gives he to his king<WH4428>; and shows<WH6213> mercy<WH2617> to his anointed<WH4899>, to David<WH1732>, and to his seed<WH2233> for<WH5704> evermore<WH5769>.
